title: Which way will the Bank of England jump on Brexit?
text:
Steering the economy is a tricky enough job at the best of times, so spare a thought for the Threadneedle Street rate-setters attempting to pull the levers during the most politically turbulent period in decades. A Brussels extension to the UK’s EU membership looks likely – in some form – on Monday.

The Prime Minister will also ask the House of Commons to grant him the December general election he craves to free the country from a “nightmare” of political paralysis – and is threatening to ask for one day after day until he gets his way.

As of now, deal, no-deal (potentially at the end of 2020) and extensions of varying length are all technically on the table, which poses a major challenge for...
description: Steering the economy is a tricky enough job at the best of times, so spare a thought for the Threadneedle Street rate-setters attempting to pull the levers during the most politically turbulent period in decades.
